p: Möse and Lukas (1957) [ 26] have observed a clear inhibition activity from lemon oil against Klebsiella pneumonia Schroeter in agar diffusion test, whereas Deans and Ritchie (1987) [ 25] reported that there is no antibacterial effect from lemon oil against this bacterium. The obtained results of MIC test showed diverse actions regarding the antibacterial activity of rosemary oil against S. aureus ranging from 20 to 400 μg/mL as reported by Panizzi et al. (1993) [ 27] due to differences in incubation period even at the same temperature.
